glsa.title: GCC-XML: Insecure temporary file usage
glsa.synopsis: An insecure temporary file usage has been reported in GCC-XML allowing for symlink attacks.

background.p: GCC-XML is an XML output extension to the C++ front-end of GCC.

description.p: Dmitry E. Oboukhov reported that find_flags in GCC-XML does not handle "/tmp/*.cxx" temporary files securely.

impact.p: A local attacker could perform symlink attacks to overwrite arbitrary files with the privileges of the user running the application.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All GCC-XML users should upgrade to the latest version:
